ws.rocket.path

Class TreePath

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.path.TreePath
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

    public final class TreePath
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>
    Default solution for iterating over path elements in a path string. The default separator between path elements is '/' (forward-slash). This class does not support modification of the underlying path.

    Although this class implements the Iterator contract, it supports iterating in both ways (although, starts from the left), and provides some useful methods to get more information about the path.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new tree path iterator.

      Creates a new tree path iterator using given path items separator.

      Returns the following path element (if the iterator is not in the end of the path) without changing the current path element cursor.
      java.lang.String getPathFromCurrent()
      Provides the (sub)path from the the current path element (included) until the end of the path.
      java.lang.String getPathToCurrent()
      Provides the (sub)path from the beginning of the path until the current path element (included).
      java.lang.String getPrevious()
      Returns the previous path element (if the iterator is not in the beginning of the path) without changing the current path element cursor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreePath

        public TreePath(java.lang.String path)
        Creates a new tree path iterator. The default path items separator will be used ('/').
        Parameters:
        path - The path string to iterate.

      • TreePath

        public TreePath(java.lang.String path,
        java.lang.String pathSeparator,
        java.lang.String extensionSeparator)
        Creates a new tree path iterator using given path items separator.
        Parameters:
        path - The path string to iterate.
        pathSeparator - The separator string to use.
        extensionSeparator - The separator string to use on last path segment. May be null for no extension check.

    • Method Detail

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Specified by:
        hasNext in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

      • hasPrevious

        public boolean hasPrevious()
        Specifies whether the current path iterator can return the previous path element using previous().
        Returns:
        A Boolean that is true when the previous() method can return the previous path element.

      • next

        public java.lang.String next()
        Specified by:
        next in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

      • previous

        public java.lang.String previous()
        Returns the previous path element and moves the current path element cursor one position backward (if the iterator is not in the beginning of the path). Otherwise NoSuchElementException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The previous path element.
        See Also:
        hasPrevious()

      • getNext

        public java.lang.String getNext()
        Returns the following path element (if the iterator is not in the end of the path) without changing the current path element cursor. Otherwise NoSuchElementException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The following path element.
        See Also:
        hasNext(), next()

      • getPrevious

        public java.lang.String getPrevious()
        Returns the previous path element (if the iterator is not in the beginning of the path) without changing the current path element cursor. Otherwise NoSuchElementException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        The previous path element.
        See Also:
        hasPrevious(), previous()

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Not to be used in tree path: results with runtime exception.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String>

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Provides the depth of the path where the path element cursor currently is positioned. At first path element, the depth is 0, at second path element, the depth is 1, and so on.
        Returns:
        A zero-based depth of the path where the path element cursor currently is positioned.

      • getExtension

        public java.lang.String getExtension()
        Provides the extension that was extracted from the last path segment. May return an empty string when the last path segment ended with the separator. Returns null when no extension is present on the last path segment.
        Returns:
        A string with the extension, or null when it's not present.

      • getPreviousPath

        public java.lang.String getPreviousPath()
        Provides the (sub)path from the beginning of the path until the current path element (excluded).

        When cursor is at the first position (the beginning of the path) or path is empty, returns an empty string.

        Returns:
        A String of the composed path.

      • getFollowingPath

        public java.lang.String getFollowingPath()
        Provides the (sub)path from the the current path element (excluded) until the end of the path.

        When cursor is at the last position (the end of the path) or path is empty, returns an empty string.

        Returns:
        A String of the composed path.

      • getPathToCurrent

        public java.lang.String getPathToCurrent()
        Provides the (sub)path from the beginning of the path until the current path element (included).

        When the path is empty, returns an empty string.

        Returns:
        A String of the composed path.

      • getPathFromCurrent

        public java.lang.String getPathFromCurrent()
        Provides the (sub)path from the the current path element (included) until the end of the path.

        When the path is empty, returns an empty string.

        Returns:
        A String of the composed path.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
